snippet: As the online gig economy grows, workers are beginning to band together to secure what they see as fairer treatment from companies that make them feel more like employees than contractors.
abstract: Workers in online gig economy are organizing to protect themselves against business structure that promises money and independence but leaves workers increasingly squeezed by powerful corporations; drivers for ride service Uber and others bristle at increasing strictures imposed by companies that leave them feeling less like independent contractors and more like maltreated employees.
lead_paragraph: As the online gig economy grows, workers are beginning to band together to secure what they see as fairer treatment from companies that make them feel more like employees than contractors.

headline.main: Uber Drivers and Others in the Gig Economy Take a Stand
headline.print_headline: Solo Workers Unite to Tame Their Gig Jobs
